column1: there's a strangled appeal for a catch down the leg side, but this clipped the pad. Some late swing
short of a length, driven into the covers off the back foot
full at the stumps, defended into midwicket, a little bit of swing on offer
full at middle and leg, clipped off the toes down to deep square
full outside leg stump, worked off the pads and places it between long leg and deep square
drags the length back a little, again on the pads, tucked wide of deep square...the line not quite right
full and straight, defended into the covers
short of a length, he goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge into his pad. Not quite as short as he thought
connects this time! Out of the ground as he latches on to a short-of-a-length delivery and pulls it high and mighty over the very short leg-side boundary. New ball, please
back of a length, 134kph, straight, defended to the bowler
this squats a little on him, but Watson manages to pull it wide of short fine leg...more bottom edge than middle
gets the line wrong this time, short outside leg, pulled wide of the keeper and short fine leg has no chance. Expensive over
round the wicket, full at off stump, driven to long-off
full at leg stump, pushed to the on side and Rose gets across
touch flatter, on the stumps, defended
full at off stump, driven into the covers
tries to use his feet, Rose sees him coming and pulls the length back, played back to the bowler
driven without any timing to the covers
spears a full ball into the pads as Watson misses his flick but that's going down leg
gets away with this and gets a boundary, chops down on a length delivery which takes a bottom edge past the stumps and beats short fine leg
angled down the leg side, bowl that again
full, straight and gone! Watson playing across the line again, misses and this time there's no doubt where it's going. Took the back leg
another one takes the pads, but this time sliding down the leg side, deflects backward of square
back of a length outside off, pushed to the bowler
brings out the scoop! From a 149kph delivery...six over fine leg for Buttler. Moves across outside off, the ball is in the slot for it, full and straight, and he flicks it all the way
full at off stump, 148kph, flicked firmly to midwicket
gives himself some room to the leg side and frees his arms through a square drive. Excellent placement wide of point
good response! A short ball outside off and Ferguson is taken by surprise as he fends it to the leg side off the splice
short, steps to the leg side, and upper cuts this high over third man...terrific shot, using Archer's pace to his advantage
back of a length, touch slower, dropped behind point
worked away from an off-stump line into square leg
dropped at mid-off! Oh boy, what a mistake. Full with some width outside off, Buttler drives it low to Botha who spills it
and this time he goes over the off side! Full outside off again, a more full-blooded drive, up and over mid-off and is just a fraction short of six
short of a length, over the leg side as he pulls. He looked a little cramped for room, but still made excellent connection to the short boundary
that's even better! Drills a full delivery straight of mid-off. Wonderful batting
very full at off stump, opens the face and steers into the covers
goes for the slower ball, it's a big full toss which he clubs straight down the ground
goes deep in the crease and whips this to deep midwicket
gets too cute and is bowled! Ferguson goes right across the crease, aiming to scoop towards fine leg, misses and the ball hits middle and off
full at off stump, he presses forward
uses his feet, it's a shorter delivery, flicked to deep square
full, driven to the covers
driven down to long-off...excellent from Rose
full outside off, 138kph, dug out into the covers
gets across the stumps and works a straight ball to deep square
short of a length, down the leg side
he nails the square drive but straight to point...instinctive from Botha there, that was travelling
some delicate touch from Root as he opens the face and steers this fine of third man, Rose runs across but can't keep it in play
a short ball, he swivels on a pull and the placement is top-notch from Root as he bisects deep square and long leg
back of a length outside off, angled through backward point and third man keeps it to a single
short outside off, he misses out as he cracks it to cover
oh dear, opens the face towards short third man and that's an awful misfield from Rose as he lets it through
this time the short delivery is pulled to deep midwicket
gets this fuller, at the stumps, driven down the ground
another long hop outside off, Root can only pick out cover off the back foot
worked off the pads in front of square...and over that could have gone for double what it did
short outside off, square drives out to deep cover
full, fired in at the toes, clipped to deep midwicket
and he strikes! Root gets a top edge as he goes for the slog-sweep, was wider outside off, much slower, Root is through the shot and it goes straight up in the air. Short fine leg gets underneath it
driven into the covers
low full toss clipped to deep midwicket
wide outside off, a flat-batted drive wide of cover and beats the sweeper...that was well struck
round the wicket, worked off the stumps down the ground
over the wicket, drags this from full outside off to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full outside off, goes for the drive and it skews off a thickish outside edge towards third man. Good chase from Rose this time
driven to long-off
opens the face and steers through the covers
full and straight, driven to long-off
plays and misses as he drives at a delivery angled across outside off
dropped as he can't hold on to a return catch, driving on the up and pops it straight back towards Faulkner
short of a length, a bottom-handed flick to deep midwicket
good catch this time! Full, wide outside off, a slower delivery, Sangha reaches out for a drive and slices a low catch to short third man
a thick inside edge through midwicket as he drives
back of a length outside off, punched down the ground to long-off
full and straight, flicked to short fine leg...another fumble
round the wicket, fires in the yorker, flicked down the ground
over the wicket, full and straight, flicked with plenty of bottom hand to deep midwicket
suggests he'll move to the leg side but stays on the stumps, worked along the ground deep into the leg side
round the wicket, clubbed down the ground and just straight of long-on...connected better than it first looked
and now it's through the off side, too short, Sams rocks backs and powers this wide of cover. He's off and running again
full toss outside off, driven wide of the cover sweeper but he does well to keep it to a single
full, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
too wide this time, a slower ball, called wide
gets this wide yorker spot on, Buttler jabs over the top of it
length ball outside off, opens the face and picks out short third man...that's clocked at 149.7kph!
swings to the leg side against a ball wide outside off, flies towards third man and lands short of the fielder
143kph, down the leg side, not called wide
chops this towards backward point, trying to play a slicing drive at a delivery outside off
swing and a miss outside off, beaten by a slower ball
finds backward point, reward for Faulkner...a short of a length delivery outside off, a back-of-the-hand slower ball, Sams aiming over the leg side, gets a big top edge
length ball on off stump, drives with an open face, another mistake in the field as this gets through short third man
slower ball, at the stumps, driven to long-on
a short ball, pulled to deep square to take him to a 37-ball fifty. Not his most explosive, now can he see the innings out?
power from Buttler! A length ball, a powerful drive on the up through the line, goes straight down the ground
gets the yorker in this time, squirts off a thick inside edge past the stumps
full toss, straight, nudged into midwicket
all the way! Into the crowd. Archer's tough night continues, dropped in short of a length, Buttler pulls it miles into the punters
full outside off, driven to deep cover...that's a much better ball than short tonight
another short ball, 129kph, he's through his pull and is beaten
short on off stump, driven to cover
flicked off the stumps to deep midwicket
gives himself room outside off and drives to deep cover
down the leg side, extra ball and extra run
on the stumps, short of a length, worked through midwicket
dropped! Would you believe it?! Another one goes down. A big top edge loops towards square leg, was a sitter for Faulkner as he trotted around from short fine leg
and the next ball is costly as he pulls a short one backward of square
big full toss, carved to point where it's well fielded but a no-ball called for height
full, wide outside off, dragged along the ground through midwicket
another big full toss, outside off, stays in his crease and pulls big over wide long-on...danger time for Hurricanes
better delivery, a slower ball, into the off side
low full toss outside off, driven down the ground
swings across the line of another low full toss, inside edge runs to fine leg
mistimes his swing into the leg side, comes off the bottom part of the bat and the lack of timing helps them back for the second
moves outside leg stump, Rose follows him but Buttler is good enough to drag it through square leg with perfect placement
this is wider outside off, a conventional sweep from Buttler and he picks out deep square
that's sweet! Anything Buttler can do...Green uses his feet and sends this perfectly straight down the ground
down the pitch again, along the ground this time to long-off
well bowled, fired in at Buttler's feet, can't get it away as it trickles to the leg side
gets well across outside off and plays the sweep, superb placement on this as he sends it behind square and the deep square-leg has no chance
crashed over cover as he gives himself some room outside leg stump, a powerful strike from Green
low full toss at the stumps, cracked to cover inside the ring this time
full toss, back to the bowler! No century for Buttler. Was shuffling to the leg side, comes off the leading edge back to Archer
a bouncer, over the top edge
full and straight, excellent fielding at mid-off as Doolan manages to intercept a well-timed drive
gets it in full outside leg, pushed down to long-on...they scamper back for the second and make it back despite a direct hit
full outside off, driven to mid-off
driven into the covers off the back foot
full, wide outside off, slices his drive towards point
no width on offer, good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off
at the stumps, worked off the pads to midwicket
touch fuller, at middle, pushed down the ground to long-on...Cook hustles through a tight over to start
round the wicket, full outside off, can't beat cover with his drive
short of a length, goes on with the arm, worked to mid-on
fuller at middle and leg, flicked through straight midwicket
full at the toes, clipped through midwicket and good placement allows them a second
touch shorter outside off but he picks out backward point
full at off stump, drives firmly but straight to cover on the edge of the ring
full toss and it's the first boundary as it's swept away over square leg
full, straight and over long-on...a lovely swing of the arms from Short as he drives clean through the line
big appeal for caught behind! Buttler was convinced as Short went for the cut. No one else seemed bothered
full outside off, whipped back past the bowler to long-on
this is pushed across outside off, a quicker delivery, beats Wade's outside edge
works a straight one off the pads into midwicket
follows Wade with a full delivery as he moves outside leg, flicked towards deep square
comes down the pitch, makes it into a very full delivery, driven into the covers
taps a length ball into the leg side
clubbed down the ground! Moves outside leg stump, gives himself the room to free his arms through a length delivery
a more round-arm delivery, into the pads, nudged into midwicket
works a full delivery down to long-on
drives on the up and mistimes in the air towards cover
full, pushed well down the leg side
high in the air over the leg side as Short flicks this, but it lands out of reach of deep square. Went miles into the air
another one down the leg side, second wide of the over
length ball into the body, Short plays with the angle into him and swings it over backward square leg
low full toss this time, at the pads, fortunate that it just costs a single as Short flicks to deep square
over the leg side again, Wade this time, a short-of-a-length delivery taken from outside off and sent behind square with a front foot pull
that's a sharp bouncer to finish with, Wade has to pull his head out of the line at the last moment
offers up a hint of width and that's cut sweetly through backward point, no chance of third man getting across
a shorter delivery, comes back into Short, nudged into midwicket
he's connected with that one! A slower ball outside off, Wade picks it up over deep midwicket. And it wasn't even out of the middle
full outside off, 141kph, clubbed to mid-on
short at off stump, guided to short third man
full toss, doesn't quite get this perfectly, swung over wide mid-on, it's chase down and they hustle a third
over the wicket, length outside off, whipped down to long-on
plays back and knocks a shortish delivery down the ground
gets across to off stump and works this through midwicket
fuller, at the stumps, driven down to long-off
digs out a full delivery to long-on
worked off the pads backward of square...steady start from Fawad
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, firmly square driven to point
fuller, outside off, and he threads the off-side gap with this cover drive...off the toe end, but placement was excellent
full toss, driven to cover
a yorker outside off, driven to mid-off on the edge of the circle
that's outta here! A good-length ball is sent out of the ground over long-on with a wonderfully clean swing
terrific placement! Opens the face and manages to steer a wide yorker past backward point. The timing was spot on
tucked off the pads into midwicket
full and straight, plenty of bottom hand as he whips to deep midwicket
driven down to long-off
knocks a length delivery along the ground through midwicket, no risks
full, wider outside off, driven sweetly to long-off
flicked off the toes into midwicket - 12 balls, 12 singles off Fawad
stays in his crease, gives himself a touch of room, swings this straight down the ground and has enough to evade long-on
driven into the off side, they look for the second to long-off but decline it
gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
full, wider outside off, swung to long-on
this is sent over wide long-off, the delivery was a little wider, tossed up with more air, and Wade connected superbly. Fifty off 28 balls
clipped to deep midwicket
tucked through midwicket
short outside off, the placement is fantastic as he rocks onto the back foot and square drives through point
fuller, at the stumps, flicked to deep midwicket
drags a shorter ball through the leg side, places it wide of deep midwicket
worked off the pads into midwicket
fuller, flicked back to the bowler
misses his attempt to slog sweep, goes underneath the bat to Buttler
short outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
too short again, Short waits and then opens the face to place it behind point. All timing, no brute force. That's fifty off 35 balls
short and wide again, misses out this time as he slices to backward point
out of the ground again as Short goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps over deep midwicket. And it wasn't even out of the middle
chopped into the pitch outside off and it bobbles towards point

a run out breaks the stand! Is that the moment Thunder needed? It was a full ball outside off, dragged down to long-on, it looked a comfortable two. Not quite sure what happened, will need to see a replay. Well, the both of them just stopped coming back for the second. A big mix-up
through his shot early, takes a toe end into the off side
length delivery at off stump, defended to cover
full outside off, a slower ball, driven to cover so three dot balls in a row
dragged down shorter and wider outside off, another slower one, dips under McDermott's bat
full, wide, connects with a drive this time to deep cover to get off the mark
back and across, taps a length delivery into midwicket
opens the face and steers this towards point
big appeal for lbw as he misses a reverse sweep, looked to be outside the line
full and straight, flicked down to long-on
length outside off, pushed square into the off side
plays back and pushes into the leg side...McDermott struggling to get going
and now he gets one away, McDermott brings out the slog sweep and that was into the crowd before you could blink. Held on the grass banks
tosses this much wider outside off, lofted wide of long-off and it's palmed back inside the rope by Green
full and straight, pumped down to long-on
gets forward and works to the leg side
driven along the ground to cover
shorter outside off, finds deep cover so he has the strike
onto the roof of the stand over midwicket as Wade takes on Cook, gets underneath a full delivery and sends it out of the ground
fuller, wide outside, driven sweetly through the covers but long-off is able to get across
short outside off, cut to deep point
flicked from full outside off through midwicket
wider outside off, Wade sees it and moves across the stumps but then misses the slog sweep
dropped! Long-on gets underneath it, went miles into the night sky as he aimed to go straight down the ground, but it slips through McAndrew's hands. Is that the key moment?
pushed across wide outside off, goes to drag it through the leg side and misses. Valuable dot
full and straight, clipped to deep midwicket
full outside off, hammered straight down the ground...that one was out of the middle
dragged down short outside off, a slower ball, picks it early and pulls it powerfully off the front foot wide of deep square
a short ball, into the body, pulled straight at long leg...that could easily have done to the boundary
into the crowd over deep midwicket as McDermott walks across his crease and fetches this from wide outside off. Big over
full, wide outside off, slices his drive high over backward point
caught at third man! Still game on here...Wade went to drive another wide delivery, his bottom hand came off the bat, the ball was sliced down to third man where Root took it comfortably.
gets the yorker in outside off, dug out towards mid-off
gives himself room outside leg then has a swing and a miss at a short-of-a-length delivery
back of a length, swings to the leg side without much timing but just a single to deep square
through him with a low full toss, McDermott aiming to flick to the leg side and this one goes under his bat. A game changing over from Rainbird?
up and over the off side, and he finds the gap! Bailey pulls one out of the locker, gives himself a touch of room, then lofts a back-of-a-length delivery over cover
that's a big full toss, into the crowd over deep midwicket and it's a no-ball for height
almost swings himself off his feet as he carves this over the off side, has to put in the hard yards to make the second but he's safe
keeps it wide outside off, Bailey throws everything at it and slices over third man
he does brilliantly to get this away, stretches to reach a very wide delivery, makes good connection and deflects it through third man, deep point can't get across
full outside off, driven down to long-off and they take on the arm for the second
full at leg stump, worked to deep midwicket as 22 come off the over. Bailey showing all his experience
another no-ball for height as the ball as carved out to deep cover. Borderline call
full, drilled straight down the ground and beats long-on...a superb run chase
